medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Approximately 18 months prior to the visit, the patient had needle biopsies due to an elevated PSA level. The initial diagnosis was made at that time, and he underwent radical retropubic prostatectomy and subsequent adjuvant radiation. Routine follow-up 18 months after prostatectomy revealed an elevated PSA level of 17.2 ng/mL.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of recurrent diverticulitis; no known drug allergies.
medical_history.family_history: Father died at 60 years from myocardial infarction; brother died at 70 years from leukemia; no other family history of cancer specified.
medical_history.social_history: Widower, worked in an office, drank alcohol occasionally, did not smoke or use illicit drugs.
